donateTogether.tgdesc: Stay in the loop about upcoming events, updates, and ways to get involved - all in one place.

howDonate.title: How to Donate Blood in 4 Easy Steps

1.title: Book Your Appointment
1.text1: Log in or create an account at
1.text2: and confirm your registration via the email.

2.title: Prepare to Donate
2.text: before booking, stay hydrated, eat a salty snack, and bring a valid photo ID.

3.title: Screen & Donate
3.text: Complete a health questionnaire, get a quick check, and donate (takes ~10 mins).

4.title: Recover & Refresh
4.text: Enjoy a snack, relax, and feel great knowing you helped save lives.

1.title: Who can donate blood?
1.desc:
To donate blood, you must:
- Be at least 17 years old.
- Be in good general health and able to perform your normal daily activities.
- Meet height and weight requirements, especially if you're between 17 and 23 years old and a first-time donor.
- Weigh at least 50 kg (110 lbs)
There is no upper age limit for donating blood. If you're unsure about your eligibility, you can take the Eligibility Quiz or call 1 888 2 DONATE (1-888-236-6283).

2.title: I've never donated before. What should I expect?
2.desc:
The donation process includes:
1. Registration and ID verification.
2. Health screening and questionnaire.
3. The donation itself, which takes about 10–15 minutes.
4. Post-donation refreshments and rest.

3.title: Where can I donate?
3.desc:
On main action - we donate at 67 College Street location from at 11:45 AM.

Any other day you can donate at any Canadian Blood Services donor centre in Toronto. We'll provide the address of the main event location, but you're welcome to choose a more convenient site if donating solo.

4.title: Is donating blood safe? Could I get an infection?
4.desc: Yes, donating blood is safe. All needles and equipment are sterile and used only once. The donation area is cleaned with a disinfectant before the needle is inserted to prevent any risk of infection.

5.title: Will there be photos or videos taken during donation?
5.desc: Only with your consent. During group donation events, we may have photographers or videographers present to capture the experience. You can choose whether or not to be included in any photos or videos.

6.title: I'm nervous about donating alone. Can I still participate?
6.desc:
Absolutely! 
Many first-time donors feel nervous. You can bring a friend or join a group donation event on July 26.

7.title: What if I feel dizzy or faint after donating?
7.desc:
It's common to feel a bit lightheaded after donating. We provide a recovery area with snacks and drinks to help you feel better. Most people recover quickly and can resume their normal activities shortly after. 

Donating blood is safe for athletes and those with active lifestyles. It's recommended to avoid strenuous exercise for a few hours after donating. Plan your donation around your training or work schedule to ensure you have time to rest afterward.

8.title: What if I can't join the group on the main donation day?
8.desc:
No problem! 
You can donate at any time that suits your schedule between July 16 – December 16. 
You'll still be part of the #UnitedToGive movement and receive a certificate and recognition as a project contributor.

9.title: What should i do before donation?
9.desc:
- Make sure you drink lots of water; eat a healthy meal and get a good night’s sleep.
- Have a salty snack and 500 mL of water just before you donate.
- Make sure to bring valid ID that is government-issued with your full name and date-of-birth. We’ll then order you a blood donor card for next time.

10.title: Is donating blood free? Do I get paid?
10.desc: Donating blood in Canada is a voluntary act, and donors are not paid. However, you receive tokens of appreciation, such as small gifts and recognition, and the immense satisfaction of helping save lives.

11.title: I'm short on time. How long does the donation process take?
11.desc: The whole process, from registration to post-donation rest, usually takes about an hour. The actual blood collection takes approximately 10–15 minutes.

12.title: Do I receive anything for donating?
12.desc:
Yes! Donors receive:
- A personalized digital certificate.
- A small thank-you gift (e.g., t-shirt, discounts).
- Recognition on our social media platforms (with your permission).
- The satisfaction of contributing to a life-saving cause.

whereGoes.title: Where Your Donation Goes
whereGoes.text: We’ve partnered with United Together Humanitarian Relief Inc.: a trusted Canadian nonprofit helping Ukrainians affected by the war. They work directly with hospitals and local charities in Ukraine to deliver life-saving medical supplies, equipment, and aid.

1.title: They’re local and registered in Canada
1.text: United Together Humanitarian Relief Inc. is an official nonprofit based in Toronto.

2.title: They keep things transparent
2.text: You’ll see real updates on how your donation is used — including photos and impact stories.

3.title: They work directly with hospitals in Ukraine
3.text: Your money helps buy medicine, equipment, and emergency supplies where it's needed most.

money.title: Where Your Money Goes
money.text: All funds are carefully managed and tracked in partnership with our registered nonprofit partner, United Together Humanitarian Relief Inc. If you'd like to see reports or have questions about where your donation goes, just reach out - we’re here to share.

1.title: Blood Donation Campaigns in Canada
1.li1: Promotion and coordination of donation drives with Canadian Blood Services
1.li2: Creation of educational materials and targeted digital outreach
1.li3: Logistics and volunteer coordination to run safe, high-impact events

2.title: Event Venue, Catering & Hospitality
2.li1: Renting welcoming and accessible event spaces
2.li2: Providing catering, drinks, and hospitality for guests and donors
2.li3: Covering event logistics and staff support to ensure a high-quality experience

3.title: Community Engagement & Awareness
3.li1: Organizing charity events that unite Ukrainian and Canadian communities
3.li2: Producing media content and storytelling that inspires action
3.li3: Developing partnerships with businesses and nonprofits to expand impact
